title: Chelsey Johnson
text:
Chelsey Johnson is an American author and professor, known for her 2018 debut novel "Stray City".
Stray City takes place in Portland, Oregon in the 1990s and is told in partial <a href="Epistolary%20novel">epistolary</a> style. It tells the story of a young lesbian who has a fling with a man, gets pregnant, and decides to keep the baby while dealing with the fallout from her community. Johnson lived in Portland from 2002-2009; the book was released with its own online mixtape.
Johnson is an associate professor of fiction and coordinates the creative writing program at <a href="Northern%20Arizona%20University">Northern Arizona University</a>. Prior to coming to NAU, she taught at the <a href="College%20of%20William%20and%20Mary">College of William and Mary</a> and at <a href="Oberlin%20College">Oberlin College</a>.
Johnson was born in Northern Minnesota. She received an MFA from the <a href="Iowa%20Writers%E2%80%99%20Workshop">Iowa Writers’ Workshop</a>. She has written for <a href="Ploughshares">Ploughshares</a>, <a href="The%20Rumpus">The Rumpus</a>, <a href="Elle%20%28magazine%29">Elle</a>, One Story, and <a href="NPR">NPR’s</a> Selected Shorts, and was an editor of <a href="OUT%20Magazine">OUT Magazine</a>.
Johnson was awarded a <a href="Stegner%20Fellowship">Stegner Fellowship</a> from <a href="Stanford%20University">Stanford University</a> in 2003. She has also received fellowships to the MacDowell Colony and the Virginia Center for Creative Arts. She currently lives in <a href="Flagstaff%2C%20Arizona">Flagstaff, Arizona</a> with her partner.
